snippet: Mr. Duterte’s threats have tapped a strain of resentment among some Filipinos, but the nations’ close relationship makes it unlikely that any will follow him on the path to divorce....
abstract: Philippines Pres Rodrigo Duterte says he wants United States troops to leave country in two years and signals willingness to revoke 2014 agreement allowing Pentagon to use five Philippine military bases; declaration deals potential blow to Obama administration plans to strengthen role of United States in Asia.

byline.contributor: Motoko Rich contributed reporting from Tokyo.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Duterte’s threats have tapped a strain of resentment among some Filipinos, but the nations’ close relationship makes it unlikely that any will follow him on the path to divorce.

headline.main: Rodrigo Duterte, Pushing Split With U.S., Counters Philippines’ Deep Ties
headline.print_headline: Leader’s Bluster Stands in Contrast to Filipinos’ Deep Ties to U.S.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
